alert.note: Alert for Butler; Choctaw; Clarke; Crenshaw; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued March 13 at 5:25AM CDT until March 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For tonights Freeze Watch, freezing temperatures of around 32 degrees possible. For Tuesday nights Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 to 32 degrees possible. * WHERE...Choctaw, Clarke, Wilcox, Butler and Crenshaw Counties. * WHEN...For tonights Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Tuesday morning. For Tuesday nights Freeze Watch, from late Tuesday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Given that temperatures have been well above normal for much of the past few weeks, we have issued the Freeze Watches as new, early season plant growth could be affected by a light freeze.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
